title: Manchester attack: Saffie-Rose Roussos 'could have survived with better first aid'
description: A report commissioned by the family of Saffie-Rose Roussos says she received inadequate first aid.

title: Covid-19: Australian Open competitors practise in isolation hotels
description: Some competitors must stay in their hotel rooms, following positive Covid cases on inbound flights.

title: More than 70 Australian Open players to isolate after Covid case on third flight
description: Seventy-two Australian Open players are now confined to their hotel rooms after a positive coronavirus test result on a third flight bound for the tournament.

title: Covid-19: England delivering 140 jabs a minute, says NHS chief executive
description: But Sir Simon Stevens says the health service has never been in a more precarious situation.

title: Sri Lanka v England: Tourists wobble chasing 74 after Jack Leach takes 5-122
description: England need 36 runs on the final day to win the first Test against Sri Lanka despite losing three wickets in a chaotic final session in Galle.

title: Covid: Australian Open players frustrated by hotel isolation
description: Dozens of top players are confined to hotel rooms, as people on three flights to the event test positive.

title: Covid: Church of England services hit by pandemic
description: More than half of the Church of England's 14,000 parishes will not open for Sunday services later.

title: Uganda election: Bobi Wine 'fearful for life' after Museveni win
description: The main opposition candidate rejects the result that saw President Museveni win a sixth term.

title: Biden inauguration: Executive orders to reverse Trump policies
description: The new president will repeal Trump travel bans and re-join the Paris climate accord after being sworn in.

title: Airport support scheme to launch this month
description: The government is aiming to provide grants by April to mitigate the impact of Covid travel rules.

title: Thakur and Sundar's brilliant stand keeps India's hopes alive
description: A remarkable recovery with the bat gives India an excellent chance of a draw in the decisive fourth Test against Australia.

title: Covid: 10 new mass vaccination centres to open in England
description: It comes as the government urges people to "play their part" in helping to meet vaccination targets.

title: Statues to get protection from 'baying mobs'
description: The government is planning new laws to stop England's monuments being removed "on a whim" by protesters.

title: Liverpool v Man Utd: Who made your combined XI?
description: Raised eyebrows or no real surprises? Here's the BBC Sport readers' combined Liverpool and Manchester United XI.

title: The Papers: 'Quarantine hotels' and jab for all over-18s 'by June'
description: Sunday's front pages include new plans for Covid vaccines, and lifting lockdown restrictions.

title: Airline industry needs up to another $80bn to survive pandemic
description: The world's airlines need another $70-$80bn of government aid to get through the pandemic, the industry says.

title: Virtual library gives children in England free book access
description: Pupils in England can read works by popular authors online while schools stay closed in lockdown.

title: Online clothes sellers targeted by 'creepy' messages
description: Women are sent sexually explicit messages and requests for "worn" garments.

title: Are women let down by period trackers?
description: Millions of women use apps to track their menstrual cycle, but many say they do not work well enough.

title: Will the Trump corporate backlash make a difference?
description: After the storming of the US Capitol, Donald Trump is facing "a very different set of calculations".

title: G7: UK to host Cornwall seaside summit in summer
description: The leaders of the US, France, Germany and other leading economies will meet in Cornwall in June.

title: Shukatsu sexism: The Japanese jobseekers fighting discrimination
description: Japanese job hunters are more diverse than ever and they are demanding change.

title: Avenue Beat: How do the F2020 singers avoid becoming a one-hit wonder?
description: Avenue Beat scored a breakout hit with the pandemic anthem F2020. So what do they do next?

title: Wilmington 1898: When white supremacists overthrew a US government
description: In 1898 a white mob stormed Wilmington, North Carolina and forced locally elected leaders to resign.

title: Fighting for the Parthenon marbles
description: In the 1980s Greece demanded Britain return the Parthenon marbles, a sculptural frieze removed by Lord Elgin almost two hundred years earlier.

title: The man startling millions of starlings with lasers
description: During starling season in winter, up to four million of the birds descend on Rome, covering streets and vehicles with their droppings.

title: Lekki toll gate shootings: What really happened?
description: Mayeni Jones investigates what happened when the army opened fire on protesters in Lagos in October.

title: Lockdown mental health: Tips for helping your child
description: Lockdown has seen an increase in children under 11 seeking counselling according to the NSPCC.

title: Magicians mark 100 years of 'sawing woman in half' trick
description: Illusionists are celebrating a century since the trick of sawing a woman in half was first performed.
